Detailed Description

A Room Wall.

Wall are bounded by a single line, rather than by a rectangle.

Member Function Documentation

void Wall::CreateWallSegment ( double  XPos1,
double  YPos1,
double  XPos2,
double  YPos2 
)

Creates a Wall, using a starting point and an ending point.

Create should be called only after UseTiles(). This function is slower than Wall::CreateWallVector() due to an inverse cosine.

void Wall::CreateWallVector ( double  XPos,
double  YPos,
double  rotationAngle,
float  length 
)

Creates a Wall, using a starting point, a rotation, and a length.

Create should be called only after UseTiles(). This function is faster than Wall::CreateWallSegment() and should be used when possible.

bool Wall::Render (  ) 

Renders the Wall.

If the Wall is invisible or dead, it is not rendered.

Returns:
TRUE if rendering is possible, or if the Wall is dead or invisible.

int Wall::GetExitRoom (  ) 

Returns the room number that this wall exits to.

Returns:
-1 if there is no exit, the room number otherwise.
